title: Tom Curry and Sam Underhill have a partnership that can match any other in world rugby, and this is only just the start
text:
When I look at Tom Curry and Sam Underhill on the pitch I think they could be brothers. They instinctively know where each other is at all times and can sense when the other is in trouble and what they need to do to help.

Their partnership has been the single biggest success story in this campaign, and their performance in the semi-final against the All Blacks went a long way towards changing the guard in world rugby - something I believe happened on Saturday. This was no one-off from a pair of flankers who, injury permitting, will both win a century of caps. Last weekend they dethroned David Pocock and Michael Hooper and on this occasion they left Ardie Savea, Scott Barrett and Sam Cane trailing...
description: When I look at Tom Curry and Sam Underhill on the pitch I think they could be brothers.
